events.message: The insured filed a claim after his car was involved in a rear-end collision at a traffic stop, reporting significant damage to the rear bumper and tail lights.
The claim has been classified under auto accident due to keywords detected such as car, collision, and accident in the initial report.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to manage the case and review the details submitted by the claimant.
Confirmation sent to the claimant acknowledging receipt of the accident claim and outlining next steps for processing.
The claimant was requested to provide photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and a copy of the driver’s license for verification.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including detailed images of the damaged rear end and official police accident report.
An investigation into the accident circumstances began, focusing on the collision cause and verification of submitted documents.
The investigative team confirmed fault of the other driver and validated all documentation provided by the insured.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover repair costs of the rear bumper and tail light replacement according to policy limits.
The claimant responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the prompt assistance received.
The claim was officially approved by the claims manager after confirming the settlement aligns with policy coverage.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was issued to the claimant’s account to cover all approved repair expenses.
The claim was formally closed after confirming repair completion and receiving final customer confirmation of satisfaction.
All claim records, correspondence, and documents were securely archived in the system for future reference and compliance.
